helios

Class ValidatorError

  • java.lang.Object
    • helios.ValidatorError

  • public class ValidatorError
extends java.lang.Object

    Represents a validator error. It gathers information related to the error raised: value, error key, and a property.

    Since:
    0.1.0

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.lang.String key
      The key that represents the error
      java.lang.String keyI18n
      The key that represents the error for the current property.
      java.lang.String property
      The name of the property (if any) that was validated and raised the error
      java.lang.Object value
      Represents the value raising the error

    • Constructor Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • ValidatorError

        public ValidatorError(java.lang.Object value,
                      java.lang.String property,
                      java.lang.String key,
                      java.lang.String keyI18n)
        Parameters:
        value - the value that raised the error
        property - the property the validator was validating (if any)
        key - the key error. It can be used to translate the error
        keyI18n - the key error aware of the current property path
        Since:
        0.1.0

    • Method Detail

      • copyWithProperty

        public ValidatorError copyWithProperty(java.lang.String newProperty)

        A ValidatorError is an immutable object. It can only be created once. The only reason we could think of mutating a given ValidatorError is to complete the property path.

        This method has been created for that purpose. It respects the idea of having an immutable object. That’s why it creates a new ValidatorError with the same values that the current one but with different property value.

        Parameters:
        newProperty - the property of the new instance
        Returns:
        a new ValidatorError with same value and key but with different property
        Since:
        0.1.0

      • error

        public static ValidatorError error(java.lang.Object value,
                                   java.lang.String errorKey)

        Creates a new instance of a ValidatorError for a given value an identified with a given error key.

        Parameters:
        value - the value that produced the error
        errorKey - the error id
        Returns:
        an instance of ValidatorError
        Since:
        0.1.0

      • errors

        public static java.util.List<ValidatorError> errors(ValidatorError... errors)

        This is a utility method to easily build a ValidatorError list.

        Parameters:
        errors - elements of type ValidatorError
        Returns:
        a List of elements of type ValidatorError
